content:
• Monday, October 8, 2012
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ1 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $83.4M (+53% Y/Y)...

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ1 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $83.4M (+53% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW) -14.9% AH after warning its expects Q3 revenue of $448M, below a...

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW) -14.9% AH after warning its expects Q3 revenue of $448M, below a $476.6M consensus. The company blames soft transcatheter heart valve (THV) sales, which in turn were blamed on European austerity measures, a lack of U.S. reimbursement for certain inoperable patients, and a "more pronounced effect" from summer vacations. Edwards expects 2012 THV sales to hit the low end of its guidance range, should the FDA approve a new treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ALNC

    Alliance Financial (ALNC +16.5%) jumps to an all-time high after agreeing to a takeover by NBT...

    Alliance Financial (ALNC +16.5%) jumps to an all-time high after agreeing to a takeover by NBT Bancorp (NBTB -3%) in a deal valued at ~$233M that combines two upstate New York lenders. ALNC shareholders will receive 2.1779 shares of NBT common stock, or ~$48.24/share based on Friday's close, a 22% premium.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +10.2%) soars after Bloomberg Industries claims the prescription insurer payment...

    Vivus (VVUS +10.2%) soars after Bloomberg Industries claims the prescription insurer payment rate for the company's Qsymia obesity drug rose 500 bps to 36% in its second week of availability. Vivus had previously suggested the initial coverage rate would be minimal. Also, Vivus has added Express Scripts to Qsymia's home delivery pharmacy network.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • CF

    Shares of chemical and fertilizer producers fall after Citi says the recent spike in natural gas...

    Shares of chemical and fertilizer producers fall after Citi says the recent spike in natural gas prices could affect Q4 earnings. Natural gas is used as a feedstock for ammonia production and typically makes up 60%-80% of cash costs, which could affect North American producers such as CF Industries (CF -2%) and Agrium (AGU -1.2%). Also: DOW -0.7%, LYB -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • LLY

    Eli Lilly (LLY +2.6%) pops after a new study shows its experimental Alzheimer’s treatment...

    Eli Lilly (LLY +2.6%) pops after a new study shows its experimental Alzheimer’s treatment slowed memory loss and cognitive decline in early-stage patients by ~30%, offering the first evidence that a medication may hamper the course of the ailment. The independent study supports LLY’s August report that showed the drug, solanezumab, slowed mental decline in those with mild Alzheimer’s.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +5.9%) surges after announcing a product refresh (I, II, III, IV) that includes...

    Polycom (PLCM +5.9%) surges after announcing a product refresh (I, II, III, IV) that includes CloudAxis, a software-based solution that combines enterprise videoconferencing with support for communications between Web-based solutions such as Skype, Facebook, and Google Talk. Polycom plans to sell CloudAxis, which could put it on better footing against Cisco and help stem share losses to upstarts such as Vidyo, to enterprises and service providers starting in Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • AOBC

    Gun makers Smith & Wesson (SWHC +2.8%) and Sturm, Ruger (RGR +1.8%) are up after Benchmark...

    Gun makers Smith & Wesson (SWHC +2.8%) and Sturm, Ruger (RGR +1.8%) are up after Benchmark says last week's selloff was overdone. The weakness resulted from a slight slowdown in National Instant Criminal Background Checks during September, but the firm notes that handgun background checks were up 23% and handguns represent the vast majority of sales for both gunsmiths.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical (EMN -3.7%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Gilford Securities based on...

    Eastman Chemical (EMN -3.7%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Gilford Securities based on valuation and a belief that the Solutia acquisition was expensive. The firm thinks 10x EBITDA is a full price for a business that has been put through a cost-cutting wringer, making $100M in cost synergies by year-end 2013 look ambitious, and that gets most of its earnings from one product.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • TXN

    ISI's Sumit Dhanda downgrades his rating for the chip industry to Neutral, while also...

    ISI's Sumit Dhanda downgrades his rating for the chip industry to Neutral, while also downgrading analog chipmakers Texas Instruments (TXN -0.5%), Linear Tech (LLTC -0.7%), Analog Devices (ADI -0.7%), Power Integrations (POWI -3.5%), and Intersil (ISIL -7.3%) in particular.  Dhanda, whose move follows a selloff in chip stocks thanks to negative data (I, II), thinks macro issues could lead industry sales to fall 2% in 2013. JPMorgan has also downgraded Intersil, citing PC weakness, share loss, and a possible dividend cut. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • AFFX

    Affymetrix's (AFFX -15%) warning that it’s seeing academic institutions pull back on...

    Affymetrix's (AFFX -15%) warning that it’s seeing academic institutions pull back on spending could ripple through other science equipment makers, Mizuho analyst Peter Lawson says. While Mizuho continues to recommend AFFX as a Buy on valuation, it's trimming estimates and turns negative on academically-exposed names: ILMN +1%, LIFE -0.7%, FLDM -1.3%, TMO -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • SBOW

    Swift Energy (SFY -5.2%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at SunTrust on valuation concern, saying...

    Swift Energy (SFY -5.2%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at SunTrust on valuation concern, saying "while numerous new wells are coming online this quarter, it appears the company may have trouble reaching guidance... The lower production carried into next year causes Swift to now trade in line with a number of peers."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • TSM

    TSMC (TSM -3.3%) falls after both BofA/Merrill and Credit Suisse downgrade the company. TSMC,...

    TSMC (TSM -3.3%) falls after both BofA/Merrill and Credit Suisse downgrade the company. TSMC, the world's top chip foundry, had recently rallied to levels last seen during the Dot.com bubble, in no small part thanks to its heavy exposure to Apple/Samsung suppliers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3%) CEO William Lynch feels good about the bookseller's ability to...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3%) CEO William Lynch feels good about the bookseller's ability to grow in the tablet market, saying preorders for the latest Nook devices are the highest he has seen. Lynch says there can be more than one winner in tablets, and BKS will have more holiday distribution at Target and Wal-Mart than ever - two huge channels that aren't carrying Amazon's Kindle.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • MWW

    After falling Friday afternoon on a dealReporter scoop claiming buyout talks with a P-E firm...

    After falling Friday afternoon on a dealReporter scoop claiming buyout talks with a P-E firm ended earlier in the week, Monster (MWW +5.8%) is rallying today. Is the Street confident one or more suitors is still interested?
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +6.8%) surges as iron ore prices jump. Iron ore for immediate...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +6.8%) surges as iron ore prices jump. Iron ore for immediate delivery in China rose 6% to $110.40/ton, the biggest gain in a month, according to data from The Steel Index Ltd. Chinese steel mills are down to about two weeks of iron ore on hand at the mills, Seth Walters writes in presenting a case for rising iron ore prices through year's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • BP

    BP (BP +0.2%) brought in a combined $5B from the sale of its Texas City and Carson refineries,...

    BP (BP +0.2%) brought in a combined $5B from the sale of its Texas City and Carson refineries, more than the $4B it initially had expected to get from the properties, but while each deal equaled $2.5B, the price for the actual facilities is far apart. The bulk of the Marathon (MPC +7%) deal is the inventory the facility held; the refinery itself was sold at nearly half the price of Carson.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • QUAD

    Quad/Graphics (QUAD +2%) expands its printing agreement with Time Inc. in a deal valued at more...

    Quad/Graphics (QUAD +2%) expands its printing agreement with Time Inc. in a deal valued at more than $900M to handle ~85% of the print work for 19 magazines including Time, People, Sports Illustrated and Money. The work represents a 35% increase in incremental Time Inc. print volume for QUAD over the term of the agreement, beginning in Jan. 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • VIAV

    Not surprisingly, optical component vendors JDS Uniphase (JDSU -4%), Finisar (FNSR -3.3%), and...

    Not surprisingly, optical component vendors JDS Uniphase (JDSU -4%), Finisar (FNSR -3.3%), and NeoPhotonics (NPTN -2.9%) are lower following Oclaro's (OCLR -7.6%) FQ1 warning. Fabrinet (FN -3.8%), which manufactures optical components for Oclaro and others, is also lower. Needham has responded by arguing Oclaro's problems probably aren't affecting other companies, and that Finisar will post in-line results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +3.7%) pops after announcing it will supply 50MW of modules for two solar...

    First Solar (FSLR +3.7%) pops after announcing it will supply 50MW of modules for two solar plants in the Indian state of Rajasthan. Construction on the projection is expected to start this year, and finish in Q1 '13. First Solar announced in August it would develop solar farms in India, a market that's seeing demand pick up after a slow start. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +4%) jumps after announcing a partnership with British mobile gambling provider...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +4%) jumps after announcing a partnership with British mobile gambling provider Probability PLC. Probability will use Glu's IP "create a suite of Glu-branded mobile slot games" that will be distributed within markets where Probability has been cleared to do business - the first being the U.K. and Italy. Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) is hoping to launch real-money gambling titles in international markets in 1H13.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • KMX

    CarMax (KMX +10.7%) shares pop 10%-plus at the open, as ITG Research says the company's...

    CarMax (KMX +10.7%) shares pop 10%-plus at the open, as ITG Research says the company's retail revenue growth is accelerating. KMX's used retail revenue growth is tracking up 16.7% Y/Y vs. 13.3% and same-store used unit retail sales likely are ahead of Street estimates, ITG says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • GDOT

    More on Wal-Mart/AMEX (previous): Against Bluebird's long list of $0 fees is Green Dot's (GDOT...

    More on Wal-Mart/AMEX (previous): Against Bluebird's long list of $0 fees is Green Dot's (GDOT -20%) $5.95 monthly fee with 62% of its business coming from Wal-Mart - a "death blow," writes firstadopter. Also keep an eye on NetSpend Holdings (NTSP -5.2%), another provider of prepaid debit cards.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • NOG

    An early spike In Northern Oil & Gas (NOG +1.6%) is attributed to takeover chatter...

    An early spike In Northern Oil & Gas (NOG +1.6%) is attributed to takeover chatter making the rounds. Even with strong financial prospects and a recent management overhaul, NOG's stock has traded at a significant discount to peers since the shorts attacked it a year ago, and some analysts think a sale may be the ultimate endgame.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 5 Comments
  • ZTCOY

    More on Vringo: The company announces it's suing ZTE's (OTCPK:ZTCOY) U.K. unit over 3 patents...

    More on Vringo: The company announces it's suing ZTE's (OTCPK:ZTCOY) U.K. unit over 3 patents deemed to be infringed by ZTE's mobile phones and infrastructure gear. The patents appear to be among those Vringo (VRNG +15%) recently acquired from Nokia, and could likely just as well be used in suits against other mobile hardware vendors. Some of the Nokia patents were declared to be standards-essential, and probably need to be licensed on FRAND terms. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • AXP

    More on Wal-Mart/AMEX's Bluebird (previous): By partnering with AXP, it appears WMT has made its...

    More on Wal-Mart/AMEX's Bluebird (previous): By partnering with AXP, it appears WMT has made its move into banking (previously denied to it in the 90s by Greenspan, among others). On the conference call, it's indicated Bluebird will move into check-writing in 2013. Monthly fee $0, Set up fee $0, Direct Deposit fee $0. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 4 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR +2.3%) rallies after SunTrust and Lazard respond positively to a...

    Questcor (QCOR +2.3%) rallies after SunTrust and Lazard respond positively to a UnitedHealth/Oxford policy update letter (.pdf) regarding Acthar gel coverage, which produced a selloff on Friday. SunTrust argues the update should reassure investors Acthar has value in treating nephrology and MS, while Lazard claims it's a positive given investor fears following Aetna's move to limit coverage. 40.3% of Questcor's float was shorted as of Sep. 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • CGI

    Celadon (NYSE:CGI) +1.6% premarket after the trucking company projects Q1 earnings above analyst...

    Celadon (NYSE:CGI) +1.6% premarket after the trucking company projects Q1 earnings above analyst expectations, citing a boost in revenue from acquisitions and a newer fleet of vehicles that helped cut maintenance costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • TPCG

    Premarket gainers: TPCG +11%. VRNG +9%. NFLX +7%. MDRX +7%.Losers: REGI -20%. GDOT -19%. NTSP...

    Premarket gainers: TPCG +11%. VRNG +9%. NFLX +7%. MDRX +7%.
    Losers: REGI -20%. GDOT -19%. NTSP -13%. AFFX -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS) -8.1% after announcing CEO Jay Bhatt is resigning as of Dec. 7,...

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS) -8.1% after announcing CEO Jay Bhatt is resigning as of Dec. 7, and withdrawing its guidance for FQ4 (Nov. quarter) constant currency Y/Y revenue growth of -2% to +1%. Phil Pead, previously non-executive chairman, has been named executive chairman while a search begins for a new CEO. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is downgraded to Sell with price target of $16 at BTIG. Previously never...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is downgraded to Sell with price target of $16 at BTIG. Previously never that enthusiastic about Facebook, BTIG is reportedly noting the collapse of payment revenues and questioning the effectiveness of mobile ads. Shares -2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 4 Comments
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences (NASDAQ:EXAS) shares could get a lot healthier if its test aimed at early...

    Exact Sciences (NASDAQ:EXAS) shares could get a lot healthier if its test aimed at early detection of colon cancer really works, Barron's writes. If the trial results, expected early next year, are favorable, the test could hit the market in 2014 and the company's annual revenue could top $500M or even $1B by the end of this decade if the test gains wide acceptance. EXAS +7.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG) has its price target upped to $10 from $6.50 at Maxim Group following last week's...

    Vringo (VRNG) has its price target upped to $10 from $6.50 at Maxim Group following last week's legal victory against Google. "The company now has about $50M in cash and is well-positioned to enter negotiations with Google," writes Maxim (via Notable Calls). Shares +7.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • AXP

    American Express (NYSE:AXP) and Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) launch Bluebird - "an alternative to debit...

    American Express (NYSE:AXP) and Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) launch Bluebird - "an alternative to debit and checking accounts." The service appears designed to allow customers the sorts of things they're used to, but no longer getting for free from basic checking. The most immediate casualty is Green Dot, which now must face cheaper competition from its largest customer (Wal-Mart). GDOT -14% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 3 Comments
